revised_title: Comparing the Light of the Sun with That of the Fixed Stars
tldr: Wollaston compares the light of the sun with that of a star, specifically Sirius, using a method involving a lens and a telescope. He estimates that the light from Sirius is not greater than one to twenty thousand millions compared to the sun. He also calculates the distance at which the sun would need to be viewed to have the same brightness as Sirius.
